handleCustomPayload
handleCustomPayload(message, messengerUserId)

Handles payloads which are usually defined by the operator inside the NLP service.

Parameters :
Name Optional Description
message No

Final response from the NLP service which should be sent to the user.
messengerUserId No

User identifier. Has to be depseudonymized at this point!
Returns : ChatAdapterResponse
transformChatAdapterRequestResponseToNlpResponse
transformChatAdapterRequestResponseToNlpResponse(request)

This function will be called if the processing is interrupted after the first interceptor (chatToCore). The generic ChatAdapterRequest is directly transformed into a generic NlpResponse without sending it to an NLP service. This means that the score and most other information is irrelevant, we only care about possible actions set in the first interceptor.

Parameters :
Name Optional Description
request No

An (interrupted) ChatAdapterRequest.
Returns : NlpResponse
transformNlpResponseToChatAdapterResponse
transformNlpResponseToChatAdapterResponse(nlpMessage, messengerUserId)

Transforms multiple generic NLP messages into an array of generic ChatAdapterResponses.

Parameters :
Name Optional Description
nlpMessage No

Final message that should be sent to the user.
messengerUserId No

User identifier. Has to be depseudonymized at this point!
Returns : ChatAdapterResponse[]

Array that can be processed by a ChatAdapter.
transformToChatAdapterResponse
transformToChatAdapterResponse(message, messengerUserId)

Transforms a single NlpMessage into a ChatAdapterResponse.

Parameters :
Name Optional Description
message No

Final response from the NLP service which should be sent to the user.
messengerUserId No

User identifier. Has to already be depseudonymized!
Returns : ChatAdapterResponse

src/framework/chat_adapter/facebook/communication/convertRequest.ts

convertFacebookRequest
convertFacebookRequest(message)

Converts a Facebook message into a generalized format which is used for further processing steps. Currently supported types are:

  1. Standard text messages.
  2. attachments including files, audio, video, images. All other message types (e.g. a transmitted location or other templates) are currently not directly supported and combined in a invalid type. The payload (here: all information included in the message received) is added as a payload in the invalid messages, you can thus still handle messages with formats that are not supported by the framework if you use the first interceptor (chatToCore).
Parameters :
Name Optional Description
message No

A message received from Facebook and thus includes Facebook-specific information. Information not required for further processing is discarded.
Returns : ChatAdapterRequest

A message in the generalized internal format.
makeRequest
makeRequest(type, message: any, isFromAdmin: boolean)

Helper to convert a received and supported request into the generalized format for the core.

Parameters :
Name Type Optional Description
type No

The message type.
message any No

The payload. Can be a string (text request), attachment or anything else if the message type is known.
isFromAdmin boolean No

Signals if a message has been sent by the page administrator (which is NOT the user).
Returns : ChatAdapterRequest

A message using the generalized framework format.

convertToImage
convertToImage(response)

Images can have a title or no title. The title should be included in your response and visualized accordingly. Images are automatically retrieved from the url specified. Stickers also count as images.

Parameters :
Name Optional Description
response No

Image attachment that should be sent back to the user.
Returns : FacebookAttachmentMessage

An image in the Facebook format.

src/framework/core/utils/responseUtils.ts

createNoResponse
createNoResponse(statusCode, userId)

Used if no visible response should be sent to the user (e.g. if you only want to send a response with a status code to the messaging platform). Use with care: Not sending a message usually confuses the user. You might want to send NoResponse if you send another Response from your interceptor, especially a message format not supported by the emubot framework.

Parameters :
Name Optional Description
statusCode No

HTML status code sent back to the messenging platform.
userId No

User identifier. Has to already be depseudonymized!
Returns : NoResponse
createResponse
createResponse(payload, statusCode, userId)

Create a generic response of type T. Implies that the user should receive a visible response.

Parameters :
Name Optional Description
payload No

Generic payload.
statusCode No

HTML status code sent back to the messaging platform.
userId No
Returns : Response<T>

src/framework/nlp_adapter/communication/postContexts.ts

createPostRequestConfiguration
createPostRequestConfiguration(internalUserId, agentName, contexts)
Parameters :
Name Optional
internalUserId No
agentName No
contexts No
Returns : request.OptionsWithUrl
postContexts
postContexts(internalUserId, agentName, contexts)

Posts a list of contexts to the NLP backend. The context system is based on the Dialogflow context system. If the NLP backend that you are using does not use a context system you can just ignore these requests. The request will then be sent to the route /postContexts and includes an JSON object with the following data:

```

  • {
  • lifespan: number,
  • contexts: string[],
  • user: string
  • }
  • ```
Parameters :
Name Optional Description
internalUserId No

The pseudonymized identifier which is used to define a session for a specific agent.
agentName No

Used to define the agent whose contexts shall be deleted.
contexts No

List of contexts that will be deleted from the conversation.
Returns : Promise<NlpStatus>

An NlpStatus, signaling whether the request was successful.

src/framework/nlp_adapter/communication/deleteContexts.ts

createRequestConfigurationAllContexts
createRequestConfigurationAllContexts(internalUserId, agentName)
Parameters :

createRequestConfigurationSelectedContexts(internalUserId, agentName, contexts)
Parameters :
Name Optional

agentName No
contexts No
Returns : request.OptionsWithUrl
deleteAllContexts
deleteAllContexts(internalUserId, agentName)

Deletes all contexts which are currently active for a certain agent. The context system is based on the system used by Dialogflow. If you are using NLP backend that does not use a system like that you can just ignore these requests. The requests will delete on the route /deleteAllContexts with the following JSON:

```

  • {
  • user: string
  • }
  • ```
Parameters :
Name Optional Description
internalUserId No

The pseudonymized identifier which is used to define a session for a specific agent.
agentName No

Used to define the agent whose contexts shall be deleted.
Returns : Promise<NlpStatus>

An NlpStatus, signaling whether the request was successful.
deleteSelectedContexts
deleteSelectedContexts(internalUserId, agentName, contexts)

Deletes a list of contexts from the conversation. The context system is based on the system used by Dialogflow. If you are using an NLP backend that does not use a context system you can just ignore these requests. The request will delete on route /deleteContexts with the following JSON:

```

  • {
  • contexts: string[],
  • user: string
  • }
  • ```
Parameters :
Name Optional Description
internalUserId No

The pseudonymized identifier which is used to define a session for a specific agent.
agentName No

Used to define the agent whose contexts shall be deleted.
contexts No

List of contexts that will be deleted from the conversation.
Returns : Promise<NlpStatus>

An NlpStatus, signaling whether the request was successful.

src/framework/core/defaultConfig.ts

dummyHandleMessage
dummyHandleMessage(_, userId)

Default configuration which is set in the absence of any other configuration. In this case the framework will not run the message through the core pipeline since that would require a valid NLP configuration. The framework will start with the CLI adapter.

Parameters :
Name Optional
_ No
userId No
Returns : Promise<Response<ChatAdapterResponse[]>>

src/framework/core/utils/findBestNlpAnswerForTextRequest.ts

findBestNlpAnswerForTextRequest
findBestNlpAnswerForTextRequest(message, internalUserId, primaryAgentResponse, index: number)

Tries to find the best matching answer for an incoming request by the user. The message is sent to every agent sorted by descending agent importance until a response with a high-enough score is returned. The primary agent's answer servers as a fallback solution if no answer passes our scoring threshold.

Parameters :
Name Type Optional Description
message No

Incoming TextRequest that should be processed.
internalUserId No
primaryAgentResponse No

Answer from the first NLP agent. Will be used if no agent returns an answer with a sufficient score.
index number No

Index of the agent to whom the message will be sent.
Returns : Promise<NlpResponseData>

src/framework/core/utils/generateId.ts

generateId
generateId()

Function to generate random user IDs.

Returns : string

a 20 byte random hex string which can be used as a user identifier.

src/framework/core/getConfig.ts

getConfig
getConfig()

Convenience function to provide access to the current configuration.

Returns : Config<ChatAdapter, NlpAdapter>

The current configuration.
setConfig
setConfig(userConfig)

Function that sets a provided configuration file. Please note that the emubot framework can not change the configuration while it is already running. Calling this function while the emubot framework is running will lead to unexpected behaviour.

Parameters :
Name Optional Description
userConfig No

Configuration with which to run the emubot framework.
Returns : void

src/framework/nlp_adapter/dialogflowV2/communication/responseConverters.ts

getContext
getContext(context, agent)

Convert Dialogflow contexts into the generalized format. Dialogflow returns a path with some information regarding the agent and the context name. We split the path, take the last part of the path (only the context name) and set it as our context name.

Parameters :
Name Optional
context No
agent No
Returns : NlpContext
toNlpMessage
toNlpMessage(message)
Parameters :
Name Optional
message No
Returns : NlpMessage | undefined
toNlpStatus
toNlpStatus(response)
Parameters :
Name Optional

src/framework/core/utils/getOrderedAgents.ts

getOrderedAgents
getOrderedAgents()

Get a sorted list of all configured agents.

Returns : AgentWithName[]

an array of agents ordered descending with regards to their execution index. Execution index: increasing index means decreasing importance. It is set in the config.

src/framework/core/handleReceivedMessage.ts

handleMessageAfterThirdInterceptor
handleMessageAfterThirdInterceptor(response)

Transforms the final messages into the format required by the ChatAdapter.

Parameters :
Name Optional Description
response No

Final response from the NLP service which should be sent to the user. Important: response.userId has to be already depseudonymized!
Returns : Response<ChatAdapterResponse[]>

An array of ChatAdapterResponses constructed from the incoming responses.
handleMessageDependingOnMessageType
handleMessageDependingOnMessageType(chatAdapterRequest, internalUserId)

Message is further processed according to the type:

  1. Invalid: If the message is still invalid after returning from the first interceptor (chatToCore),
          the user receives an error message. Results in a 400 Bad Request.
  2. Text: Text messages are sent to an NLP service.
  3. Valid, non-interrupted and non-text messages (currently: all attachments): return error. If you want to handle such messages: Set the interruptProcessing-flag during the first interceptor.

If you want to handle additional types (like attachments), send them in the interceptor and return a NoResponse to the emubot framework.

Parameters :
Name Optional
chatAdapterRequest No
internalUserId No
Returns : Promise<Response<ChatAdapterResponse[]>>
handleReceivedMessageInCore
handleReceivedMessageInCore(request, messengerUserId)

Processes an incoming message, see here for more detailed information.

Parameters :
Name Optional Description
request No

Message received from the user, already transformed into the generalized ChatAdapterRequest-type.
messengerUserId No
Returns : Promise<Response<ChatAdapterResponse[]>>

An array of ChatAdapterResponses with the content that should be sent to the user. The responses are wrapped in Responses. The wrapper does not contain any further information about what to send to the user, but provides information if something should be sent to the user at all.
handleTextRequest
handleTextRequest(request, internalUserId)

Processes an incoming text request: retrieves best answer from NLP service.

Parameters :
Name Optional Description
request No

Message received from the user, already transformed into the general ChatAdapterRequest-type.
internalUserId No
Returns : Promise<Response<ChatAdapterResponse[]>>

The final ChatAdapterResponse[] which will be sent to the user.

src/framework/chat_adapter/cli/communication/webhook.ts

initWebhook
initWebhook(server, app, handleRequest)

This function is used to setup a webhook that is compatible to the CliClient. GET /WEBHOOK_PATH/hello: Used to tell the framework about the connection of a new user. This route generates a new ID for that user and answers the user with the id. POST /WEBHOOK_PATH : This route handles text requests. Requests on this route are run through the processing pipeline of the frameowrk and will end be sent to the NLP service through the NLPAdapter depending on the type of message and configuration of the Interceptors.

Parameters :
Name Optional Description
server No
app No
handleRequest No

function that describes how the webhook should handle an incoming request.
Returns : void
